reviewText: Even though this was your typical childhood romance rekindled, it brought joy to my heart that things like that "do" still happen in real life.  Lisa Hartman Black looks and acts as good as always, and it was a different type of role for Rue McClanahan... it was a good role for her. My husband probably wouldn't have cared too much about it; I'd say it's more a "chic flick". But there may be some guys who'll like it, too! (I hope so!) A good "take your mind off your worries" movie & just sit back and enjoy!! I own it and have already watched it 3 times in one week, so you judge!

reviewText: Feel good, clean movies are great, and I appreciate the people who produce them. That said, that does not mean I want to watch a movie with a lame script, predictable action, and cue card emotions and dialogue. It is certainly obvious what is going to happen in this movie just from reading the back. I don't have a problem with settling in, watching a romance where I know exactly who's going to fall in love and anticipating it happening. But this movie was just a muddle of ridiculous situations and flat characters and I do not recommend!
summary: Leave this one on the shelf

reviewText: I like good clean movies (or as clean as you can get nowadays). Back to You and Me was really quite clean. There were a few utterances of mild crude language, drinking of wine, a man tries to have a cigarette and low cut shirts on women. I enjoyed the movie and would watch it again. There were several parts that I thought could have been better, but it was still entertaining.I didn't like that Syd had so many issues with her mother. Apparently she is really angry that whenever she would call her father when he was dying, her mother was never home and so hates her for this. The thing is, Syd wasn't home either. She moved away to the big city, never came home until after her father died and is also angry with him for not holding on longer so she could find the "cure" to what he died from.I also didn't like that Syd's old high school sweetheart, Gus, didn't tell the girl he was dating, Connie, that he wasn't interested. She apparently has been married and divorced several times and is determined to make Gus her next husband. You can tell from the very beginning that he isn't at all interested, especially when Syd comes back home, but he still goes out with her even though he is embarrassed and a little uncomfortable with how she shows her affection. He clearly just likes her as a friend, but can't/won't tell her that.All in all, it was very entertaining and I would watch it again. It was funny, clean and a great "feel-good" movie. I also love Dale Midkiff (Love Comes Softly). He is so soft-spoken and sweet, you like him from the very beginning.
summary: Back to You and Me - Would Watch Again

reviewText: Back to You & MeI've lived a long time and remember when you could go to a movie almost every week and see a "family" type movie in the 1950's.Today it it is so rare to find a good movie that when I see one I often buy it if there is a good reasonable story line.This story is about a middle aged female doctor.....with the body of a 19 yr old and pretty face, (who moves away from home and finally returns home and meets two guys amoung many former friends from the small town she grew up in.Of course her former "sweetheart" was a quarterback on the HS football team, now a widower with a nice kid with digestive problems, but meantime she winds up seeing "Mr. Right" in a new light of the wisdom of years and the obvious happens but not before several obstacles must be overcome, some of them painfull.I decided to buy this having seen it on "Hallmark" movie channel, and what do you know, it actually has an ending, much unlike so many Hallmark movies that leave the ending to your imigination which drives me crazy.While my passion was and still is Politics both local, national and international, history of the world and the reason for all the wars and joined the Army in 1963 for Combat Infantry (you could say I've been an agressive guy towards "bad guys" all my life to this very day, I have learned over many years so many people are not happy with their marriages and feel sorry for them because so many made the wrong choices....looks, money, you name it.I won't say I was just plain lucky to find the "Right Girl" 6 yrs my junior, I knew what I was looking for, a REAL housewife so it was a total surprise to meet my 17yr old in her senior year of high school and after having seen so much "real life" in the army via my last 1 1/2 years in the army as support for Military Intelligence, I found someone so young and untarnished by the dark side of life.....and she made me cookies for Christmas 2 mos after I met her....definitely brought out the romance in this man even tho she was so young which led to her marrying early at 18 to my age 24.The above is the explanation for why a guy turns to romantic movies after reading military history, rather gory reading by any account; even I need a break in the action which my ADHD brain craves.Here's to true love successes and happy days; enjoy the movie; both me and my wife did!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This had the potential to be really good, but it was lacking. The male lead, Dale Midkiff, was not believable in his role. His acting in this was wishy-washy. I adored his acting in "Love Comes Softly" and other parts he's played, but in this movie he made his character seem like he really could care less if he got the girl. Lisa Hartman's acting was just okay. Perhaps, it is the director's fault in all of my complaints, not the actor's? The small town is picturesque and its scenes took me in, but the story did not. There are parts that I did like but they were not strong enough to carry out a well rounded movie. I gave a four star rating because I am glad this is a "clean" movie, no bad language etc., so I will watch it from time to time.

reviewText: This was originally a Hallmark TV movie and is being released on DVD January 25th.As the movie starts we meet Nurse Brenda and a surgeon nicknamed Mr. Personality who tells a nurse that a a patient passed and the room is now available.  Finally we meet Sydney played by Lisa Hartman Black who is a sympathetic doctor who feels a tremendous burden and a heart full of remorse as one of her patients is close to dying. She decides to head home for a high school reunion. Going home isn't easy for her as she and her mother played by Rue McClanahan haven't spoken since her father passed away. She has a misconception of her mother and what happened during her fathers final months.Upon her return she finds out her mother has turned her house into the only B& B in town and has to stay there. She runs into her high school sweetheart, Gus, played by Dale Midkiff (I knew this guy from somewhere, his eyes were so familiar - He was in Pet Cemetery) who lost his wife and is now dating Connie a woman who is determined to settle down with him.High school party boy, who is now a minister plays match maker to Gus and Syd, getting them together for a picnic.Gus and his son (who has been sick since birth) take Syd on a picnic at the park and reminisce about high school days and life.Finally the inevitable happens and Gus' son takes a turn for the worse. Syd gets him to the hospital, he has surgery everything is better.Without giving the entire ending away, all loose ends are tied up on a pretty bow without being too sappy.

reviewText: It's a good movie but predictable.  High school sweethearts meet again at a class reunion years after not seeing each other and fall in love all over again.  Sidney's ( Lisa Hartman Black)  misconceived notion that her mother kinda deserted her dad while he was dying has kept her away from her small town.  Returning helps her find the truth about her mom and dad and the acceptance that she had never stopped loving Gus ( Dale Midkiff).  The movie does not give the names of the songs or performer in the credits but I recognized the obvious that it was Clint Black, Lisa's husband and ordered the cd " Spend My Time" from Amazon.  You should get that too.  Especially if you are a country music fan.  It's still worth watching if you just want something that makes you feel good without having to overthink everything.

reviewText: I only bought this movie because it was under $5. I usually can't stand Dale Midkiff because of his annoyingness on the "Love Comes Softly" movies. In this movie, however, he wasn't nearly as annoying. Rue McClannihan looks like she has had a little too much plastic surgery and I found myself staring at her face more than anything else, but other than that, this is a pretty good movie. It follows a female doctor who goes home for her (I'm guessing) 20th? high school reunion. She meets up with her old flame and they realize they still love each other. The man's son has a health issue which the doctor tries to fix. I won't ruin the ending. This is worth watching at least once.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I loved this TV movie from the first time I saw it on the Hallmark Channel- I watched it everytime it was on and even had it taped on a video so I could watch it whenever I wanted (although had to fast forward thru the commercials, which I hate!)So you can only imagine my delight when I saw this coming out on DVD!!! I couldn't put my order in fast enough.I have enjoyed Lisa Hartman (Black) since her days on 'Knot's Landing' and Dale Midkiff has my pulse going ever since he played Elvis in the miniseries based on Priscilla Presley's book Elvis & Me. So having these two adorable actors in one movie was treat enough for me! The supporting actors are just terrific too and really add to the 'real' feel of that small hometown where everyone knows everyone.Some of the scenes are alittle sappy, but overall it was a movie that I will watch over and over!If you like the Hallmark type of movie than you won't be disappointed with this one!
